page.title: 11DAY IN THE LIFE OF A FARMER
page.content: A typical day for me would be, get up at 5.45am have drink, start work 6.15, let the cows into the collecting yard and start the milking machine.I milk in a herring bone parlour with 10 cows on each side. When finished, milking equipment is washed.9.00am breakfast. Next I scrape the yard and pump the slurry into the slurry tower.I feed the cows and calves and bed with straw.12.00 _ 1.00 dinner then out into the fields to repair barbed wire fences.3.00 break for drink.I move the electric fence fire at the silage face to give the cows more to eat.Milk the cows again and clean equipment when finished I shut the cows into the cubicle house,check they are all well and separate a few that are due to calve. 6.00 tea
